newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real closes flat in quiet trading.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real closes flat in quiet trading.

text.p: Brazil's real closed steady at 1.0416 against the dollar in quiet trade in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
Despite the calmness, the market was still concerned about Brazil's worsening trade picture amid reports that December's trade gap could rise to $1.7 billion and January's to $1.5 billion.
The reports fueled speculation in the futures market that the Central Bank could speed depreciation of the real to boost exports and curb imports.
In interbank market, however, dollar flows have continued to determine the value of the real.
Preliminary figures for commercial and financial foreign exchange contracts showed a Tuesday surplus of $35 million.
In the interbank forex floating rate market, the real closed at 1.0472 to the dollar, up 0.01 percent.
In the illegal parallel market, the real rose 0.45 percent to end at 1.095 per greenback, traders said.
